content: PSA: If you have a bank account linked to FTX US, change your bank account password and stop sharing data immediately. they tried accessing this account some hours ago https:/[Suspicious link removed]/sdnaUFEzOWSource: https://twitter.com/mikemcg0/status/1591477400634023938?t=3rkdI264uiHjpxU_hIpj9w&s=19

comments.author: DanWalker
comments.body: FTX and FTX.us were both hacked at the same time, the story behind this is still unclear but it is better for everyone to remove all links and stop accessing both exchanges to avoid unfortunate incidents in the future. I wouldn't believe this was an external attack, this could be their internal attack and someone trying to collect their last property to run away. This could be the worst disaster in crypto history.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: LOL, subtle orders to evict people.Next notify will coming, "Withdraw all assets you can from FTX branded or partnered platforms, delete all your data and linked accounts. Currently all of our platforms are infected with a dangerous virus. Leave it and forget it, pretend we never served you".

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: This is why privacy is important, do you think the third party can protect your personal information? Nope, when they got hacked, the hacker can know any personal information submitted on the exchange. There's no third party or anyone can be trusted, "don't trust, verify". If anyone start to use decentralized exchange e.g. Bisq, this kind problem wouldn't happen. Also anyone should hold their coins on hardware wallet. This will impact significant effect of losing Bitcoin and personal information leaked.

comments.author: crunck
comments.body: Not only with FTX.us but also with FTX, but how to access and unlink when yesterday I saw many recommendations to delete the application and stop accessing FTX otherwise very vulnerable to other personal data attacks. Drama won't end anytime soon, it's a disaster to use a centralized exchange, I also lost money with FTX and now I am fearing for my other personal documents, here is a lesson for me and the centralized exchange users.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: This is getting worse and bolder for the FTX team. Who else would try hacking the exchange but themselves and then this time accessing the bank accounts of its app users. Kraken claimed to have identified the hackers as the token was sent to them. Obviously, they aren't very smart, didn't even look for a mixer or send it to a dex instead.

comments.body: Quote from: bittraffic on November 13, 2022, 06:44:37 AMThis is getting worse and bolder for the FTX team. Who else would try hacking the exchange but themselves and then this time accessing the bank accounts of its app users. Kraken claimed to have identified the hackers as the token was sent to them. Obviously, they aren't very smart, didn't even look for a mixer or send it to a dex instead.What's even more weird is that just a day after declaring bankruptcy, they announced that they had been hacked, once bankruptcy means they can't afford to pay users, hackers won't attack the exchange without money. If I remember correctly, FTX has not been attacked since its inception until now. I do not believe in that.
